title: How to Bake a Chocolate and Orange Cake

steps.headline: Pre-heat the oven to Gas Mark 4 (180°C/350°F).
Grease a rectangular bread tin.
steps.description: Or, if you prefer, use a medium sized round tin.

steps.headline: Measure out your ingredients.
steps.description: Put the sugar and butter into a mixing bowl and cream together.

steps.headline: Mix until the sugar and butter is smooth and creamy.
Add some of the flour and one of the eggs.
steps.description: Stir with a gradually quickening motion.

steps.headline: Keep adding more flour and one egg at a time until the mixture is smooth and fairly stiff.
steps.description: Sift in the cocoa powder and add the orange rind.

steps.headline: Spoon the cake mixture into the tin.
steps.description: Using a spatula, evenly spread the surface smooth.

steps.headline: Bake in the oven for 30-40 minutes.
Check the cake around 10 minutes before the estimated time by inserting a fork.
steps.description: If it comes out completely clean, the cake is ready. If it still needs cooking, put back in the oven and check after a further 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Begin to make the icing.
steps.description: Melt the chocolate in a bowl over a pan of boiling water. Stir in the icing sugar and butter and stir it in until the butter has melted and the mixture is smooth. Remove from the heat and add a tablespoon of water at a time. Use whilst lukewarm.

text: Pre-heat the oven to Gas Mark 4 (180°C/350°F).  Grease a rectangular bread tin. Or, if you prefer, use a medium sized round tin. Measure out your ingredients. Put the sugar and butter into a mixing bowl and cream together. Mix until the sugar and butter is smooth and creamy.  Add some of the flour and one of the eggs. Stir with a gradually quickening motion. Keep adding more flour and one egg at a time until the mixture is smooth and fairly stiff. Sift in the cocoa powder and add the orange rind. Spoon the cake mixture into the tin. Using a spatula, evenly spread the surface smooth. Bake in the oven for 30-40 minutes.  Check the cake around 10 minutes before the estimated time by inserting a fork. If it comes out completely clean, the cake is ready. If it still needs cooking, put back in the oven and check after a further 5 minutes. Begin to make the icing. Melt the chocolate in a bowl over a pan of boiling water. Stir in the icing sugar and butter and stir it in until the butter has melted and the mixture is smooth. Remove from the heat and add a tablespoon of water at a time. Use whilst lukewarm. Finished.
